incidentrule.description: the available total memory of the host is low
Too much System CPU time indicates a problem at the machine like too much swapping.
The physically available memory is low
the root disk is nearly out of free space
The available network bandwidth is continuously low. Too much traffic on the host.
Diskspace needed for stable operations is low (var space, temp space
Application Process reported Out-of-memory. A Memory Dump will be automatically triggered if not disabled in the Agent group settings.
Connection to a previously connected Application Process/Agent has been lost.

chartsource.name: High Overall Failed Page Action Rate

incidentrule.description: The overall failed page action rate exceeds the configured threshold.
incidentrule.id: High Overall Failed Page Action Rate

incidentrule.description: The average response time (median) is significantly higher than expected. Although the observed response time might be still acceptable for users, this behavior is typically caused by application or infrastructure problems and reduces the maximum throughput you can achieve.
The rate of failed transactions is significantly higher than expected.

chartsource.name: Response time degraded for slow requests

incidentrule.description: The observed response time for the slowest 10% of requests has increased significantly. This results in poor user experience and can be caused by application or infrastructure problems.
incidentrule.id: Response time degraded for slow requests

incidentrule.description: The overall failed transaction rate exceeds the configured threshold.
